page.title: 01Summary of the Area
page.content: This block is mainly agricultural land but includes most of the village of {Drayton}and a small northern part of the village of{Steventon}.In the west and central part of the area there is principally agricultural land used for growing cereals and vegetables.A smaller area of agricultural land is enclosed for catttle grazing. The{A34}Oxford to Newbury dual carriageway runs North to South through the East of the block and by_passes the villages of Drayton and Steventon which lie on the{B4017}. There is no heavy industry in this area, only three small light industrial units,a transport depot , an electricity sub_station and a Local Authority Refuse Tip. The ara is in the Vale of the White Horse District of Oxfordshire.
